channel.title: Is there a way to review your history of what servers you have played on?
channel.description: Hi, I am currently trying to find out if there Is a way to review your history of what servers you have played on? I was a donator on one particular server and would like to start playing again. If anyone could give me any clues to the name of the server that would be a big help. My paypal history says i made a donation to a 'Dominic Mcdonald', just wondering if anyone knows him at all.

item.title: Is there a way to review your history of what servers you have played on?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

No, but you can check your caches like suggested and that may work, or try to trace the email and see what it could be attached to.

I’ll lock this before more flame happens

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to review your history of what servers you have played on?

item.title: Is there a way to review your history of what servers you have played on?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:9, topic:425887”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=528568.msg3855529#msg3855529 date=1324332396]

prolly fake, and the server is most likley offline. YOU are the only person who can keep track of the games you play. BUT you can look in your c:/ folder and check all the server caches you have if you still have them.

Nonoffensively, that’s not going to do shit
Firstly You Joined a RSPS ~ Illegal
What the hell are you going to do with a cache?
All you can do is that ok, I have learned my lesson with New Rsps in a community.
MAYBE paypal can help you, claim your not the one who pressed buy now.
Paypal: It is the same computer you signed up with, therefore you paid for this product
you: The guy used Teamviewer on me
Try to get your way out of this.
[/quote]
Firstly, you are a fucken idiot, RSPS’s aren’t illegal to the player.
What the hell are you going to do with a cache? The cache are named after the servers 99% of the time, and even if they are not, they often have the ip address or at least a recent connection log to the server. That what the hell you do with a cache.
Guess what, he just got his way out of this one.
/Check mate.[/quote]
Wait, what are you smoking? Cache’s don’t contain the recent connection to a server, only the person who has the server files
What are you going to do with an ip?, and if a owner does keep a ip log there, his last ip connection is most likely to be 127.0.0.1
and
Whats a name? A server name? Wow what is that going to do? Any computer has the function to rename. There is no proof whatsoever whether its those Pi Clients the person leeches, a person who does this
is probably a person with no experience. He stole the cache from another person, so therefore, you find the person, but the cache doesn’t belong to him.

Shutup you didn’t help him at all Just stick to my solution.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to review your history of what servers you have played on?

Guess what, he just got his way out of this one.
/Check mate.
